action.action-desc: Mr. Flood introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To require Federal banking regulators to report on the implementation of recommendations from the FSOC Chairperson and Executive Orders, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Executive Capture of Banking Regulators Act.

section.header: Report on the implementation of recommendations from the FSOC Chairperson and Executive Orders

subsection.header: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
subsection.text: Section 10 of the Federal Reserve Act (12 U.S.C. 247b) is amended by inserting after paragraph (10) the following:

paragraph.header: Report on the implementation of recommendations from the FSOC Chairperson and Executive Orders
paragraph.text: The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System may not implement a non-binding recommendation made by the Chairperson of the Financial Stability Oversight Council or contained in an Executive Order unless the Board of Governors first provides the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate with—

subparagraph.text: notice that the Board of Governors intends to implement such recommendation;
a report containing the proposed implementation by the Board of Governors and a justification for such implementation; and
upon request, not later than the end of the 120-day period beginning on the date of the notice under subparagraph (A), testimony on such proposed implementation.

subsection.header: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
subsection.text: Section 324 of the Revised Statutes of the United States (12 U.S.C. 1) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Comptroller of the Currency may not implement a non-binding recommendation made by the Chairperson of the Financial Stability Oversight Council or contained in an Executive Order unless the Comptroller of the Currency first provides the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate with—
